result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Gourley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for David J. Gourley
Current: 9370N Water St, Hayward, WI 54843   (Effective: 01-04-2017)
Prior: 9370 Water Street, Apt. A, Hayward, WI 54843

Defendant David J. Gourley in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Also has 16 CF 190, 16 CF 66, 16 TR 263, 16 TR 262, 15 TR 1261, 15 TR 1262 and 15 TR 1263.  15 CF 190 State moves to amend to theft felony 943.20(1)(a)(3)(bm) DE to waive the prelim.  113 days county jail credit 85 days with good time - rest. jt/several $8015.02 - costs   / 16 CF 66 - plead to counts 2 thru 4: Probation 3 years - 30 days county jail - costs - counseling that may be recommended count 1 to be dismissed  / All traffic matters to be dismissed and used as read-ins.  Court grants motion to amend 15 CF 190 to 943.20(1)(a)(3)(bm). DE wishes to waive prelim.  Court advised DE as to his right to a preliminary exam.  DE wishes to waive prelim.  court finds DE freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.          DE entered plea of NC.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge in 15 CF 190 and counts 2 thru 4 in 16 CF 66 and count 1 is dismissed all traffic citations are dismissed and read-in.  
Victim addressed the Court

Court:  15 CF 190 - 113 days county jail with good time and credit for 85 days time served - costs $579.00  and restitution jt/several $8015.02 to Kathy Dittmer - 16 TR 263, 16 TR 262, 15 TR 1261, 15 TR 1262 and 15 TR 1263 are dismissed and read-in

16 CF 66 - Counts 2 thru 4: Sentence w/held probation 3 years - 30 days county jail to report on/before 3/3/17 at 3:00 pm with huber - any counseling DOC may impose - costs $579.00 (Bond of $250.00 to be applied towards restitution in 15 CF 190) - 16 TR 263, 16 TR 262, 15 TR 1261, 15 TR 1262 and 15 TR 1263 are dismissed and read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 3, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

David Gourley in court with atty Michael Hoffman,   Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA will be dismissing TR's after deferred agreement expires,   Suspend preliminary hearing ADA will be amending charge, and DEF will be entering into deferred agreement,  no further hearing should be necessary  set for internal review  to see if agreement is filed.   Review scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant David J. Gourley in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. time limits prev waived,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant David J. Gourley in court appearing by video from custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF has not contacted the PD for counsel.  DEF states he has been in jail since last hearing.  Court states DEF is to contact Public Defender.  Court and Atty Marcoux address bond, which continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
State appeared by Atty Poquette.  Court makes stmt - defendant not in court when the warrant was issued the defendant was in custody.  Warrant is quashed and bail forfeiture is suspended.

Case called.
Defendant David J. Gourley not in court @ 11:32 am.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Marcoux requests a warrant for failure to appear and bond forfeited.
Court authorizes warrant and authorizes start of forfeiture proceedings.
